frameDefinitions: A Material is used to make a Product.
An Agent or a Cause causes a Fluid to move from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.
In this frame a Fluid moves from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.  '
An Authority excuses an Offense that an Offender has committed, with the effect of ending or preventing any punishment.
In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.
A Location is filled or covered with the Theme.
frameExamples: These cooking <t><fex name='mat'>ingredients</fex></t> are readily available.
President Ford <t>pardoned</t> her after it came to light she was being held in Japan as an 'enemy alien' and was secretly working to subvert the broadcasts DNI
Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
The waters of the bay <t>teemed</t> with fish.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity which is used to make a <fen>Product</fen>.
The purpose for which the <fen>Material</fen> is intended.
The entity or substance that is created out of the <fen>Material</fen>.
The animate protagonist who causes the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.
An event or force that causes the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.
The entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way. It is not necessarily in a liquid state but is construed that way.
The location that the <fen>Fluid</fen> occupies initially.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> ends up in as a result  of the motion
The trajectory along which the Fluid moves, exclusive of the <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen>.
The setting in which the <fen>Fluid</fen>'s movement takes place along an unspecified <fen>Path</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the fluidic motion event is caused.
The location where the motion takes place.
<fen>Area</fen> is the setting in which the <fen>Fluid</fen>'s movement takes place on an unspecified <fen>Path</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> ends up.
The <fen>Path</fen> is the trajectory along which the <fen>Fluid</fen> moves.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> occupies initially.
The <fen>Fluid</fen> is the entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fluid</fen> flows.
The Place describes the location of the motion which has a specified Source, Path or Goal.
This role denotes the offender that seeks or gets the pardon.
Authority is the organization or person taht grants the pardon.
This role denotes the the illegal act that the <fen>Offender</fen> is pardoned for.
This role denotes the time when the pardon is given
The location at which the pardoning takes place.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
The <fen>Theme</fen> covers or fills the <fen>Location</fen>.  This role most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with or in.
<fen>Location</fen> is the object or area that the <fen>Theme</fen> fills or covers.  This frame element generally occurs as the External Argument.
The period of time during which the the Abounding_with event occurs.
listRoleExamples: Add all the <fex>ingredients</fex>, toss and chill.
Supply and placing of <fex>building</fex> materials shall be incidental to installation of the paving stones.
What happens if <fex>we</fex> drip acid on this compound?
Why did  you squirt juice <fex>onto my chair</fex>?
I spattered the egg all over the floor <fex>in the kitchen</fex>.
<fex>At Oregon Caves</fex>, a stream runs through the dining room.
Defense minister Ivanov rules out pardon <fex>for Chechen rebel leader Maskhadov</fex>.
<fex>The governement</fex> issued a pardon to the two convicts.
They demanded a pardon to John <fex>for inadverdent manslaughter</fex>.
The families demanded a <fex>posthumous</fex> pardon for the executed soldiers.

On 1 March 2002, Andreyev was found guilty of libel and conditionally sentenced
to two years in prison and then pardoned <fex>in the courtroom</fex>.
The waters of the bay teemed <fex>with fish</fex>.
<fex>The walls</fex> crawled with nanite surveillance probes.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Pictou Landing Indian Band Agreement Act
